revised_title: Automated Methods for Recovering Structure from Fragmentary Information
tldr: The author discusses the process of recovering structure from fragmentary information, focusing on the application of automated methods in archaeology. They explore the use of seriation, a one-dimensional map-making technique, to arrange objects in chronological order based on the presence or absence of specific types of artifacts. The author also touches upon the use of similarity measures and scaling algorithms to improve the accuracy of these methods.
